channel.title: Past projects and publications on Alice Feurtey.
channel.description: Recent content in Past projects and publications on Alice Feurtey.

item.title: Genomic and epigenomic architecture of a plant pathogen
item.description: Using several fully assembled Zymoseptoria genomes, we describe here a high level of conservation in genomic, epigenomic and transcriptomic composition and structure across the genus Zymoseptoria, despite previous reports of high genomic plasticity in Z. tritici. The compartmentalized genome allows the maintenance of a functional core genome co-occurring with a highly variable accessory genome.

item.title: Crop-to-wild gene flow in apple trees
item.description: During my Master’s and PhD projects, in Tatiana Giraudâ€™s group, I studied the role of inter-specific hybridisations in the evolutionary history of apple trees.

item.title: Strong Phylogeographic costructure between the anther-smut fungus and its white campion host
item.description: We demonstrated a significant and particularly strong level of host-pathogen costructure between the anther-smut pathogen Microbotryum lychnidis-dioicae and its host plant Silene latifolia. his, together with the inoculation results, suggests that coevolutionary and competitive processes are involved in the evolution of these two species.
